poem:
### Fragile Shores

Among the fragile shores—  
lines traced in dust—  
promises falter,  
while voices rise over  
withered weeds.  
Aid trickles like  
a slow drip, thirsting  
for rain, as cries echo  
in silence—  
urgent pleas float  
on the breath  
of broken tides.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gaza ceasefire live: Vance arrives in Israel as Gaza officials say level of aid delivered is far below what was promised 12.00pm BST Macron says aid routes into Gaza need to be reopened as a matter of 'absolute urgency' France’s President Emmanuel Macron called for aid routes into Gaza to be reopened as a matter of “absolute urgency”. “The situation in Gaza remains very fragile,” Macron told a news conference in Ljubljana alongside Slovenian prime". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
